titleInfo.title: Letter No. 2 from Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident at Bushire to Lieutenant-Colonel John Macdonald, Envoy to the Court of Persia

mods.abstract: Letter regarding a 'sudden and unfavourable alteration' in the money market in Bushire which had compelled Colonel Stannus to dispose of the Bills drawn by Lieutenant Colonel Macdonald on the Government of India at a reduced rate and prevented the sale of those drawn on the Bombay Government.The letter continues by reporting that at that time there was no money in Bushire and that until the next treasure cafilah [Kafila] (caravan) arrives Colonel Stannus cannot procure cash for the Residency bills or those of the Mission which are still to be disposed of.The letter concludes by bringing to Colonel Macdonald's attention a merchant at Isfahan who is prepared to exchange bengal bills for cash, should that be helpful; and refers to an enclosed cash account for the Mission's account at the Bushire Treasury, which is no longer enclosed.
